ParentCompanyName: Equilon Enterprises LLC dba Shell Oil Products US

_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill shutoff device at 85% vessel capacity, Class I, Div. 1 electrical fixtures from transfer point to 5 ft. and Class I, Div. 2 from 5 to 25 ft., Labeling of vessel (NFPA 704, Not Odorized, etc.)
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, temperature, pressure, and liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of Flex Connect, thermal relief, and strainer at offload station
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Visual inspection of entire butane system
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane (liquid storage vessel under pressure) blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with a bulk truck offloading system.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Shell - Nashville Terminal was constructed to comply with the National Fire Protection Association #58 (2004 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is this Facility's policy to adhere to all Federal, State, and Local codes/laws including adherence to the current NFPA 58 standard (2014).  If an emergency were to occur, it is this Facility's policy to notify the Nashville Fire Department and the Davidson County LEPC, as appropriate, through the 911 service.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the Centennial, Baptist, Vanderbilt, and/or Saint Thomas Hospitals and associated ambulance service (Nashville-Davidson County Metro) via 911.  The Facility trains its employees to respond to small or initial stages of an emergency.



Shell - Nashville Terminal transfers/stores refined product (regular/premium gasoline and diesel fuel) and handles product additives, including the liquefied butane blending system (direct injection into refined product lines).  The Risk Management Program covers the butane blending system including the associated piping, the LPG vessel, the blending skid, sampling unit, and the truck offloading station product injection points.



Shell - Nashville Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D - Program Level 3).  Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor - Occupational Safety and Health Administration Process Safety Management regulations for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119) inclusive of its 14 compliance elements.  This butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained to meet or exceed the NFPA #58 requirements for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage.  



To date, this Facility has never had an accident involving the butane blending system resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the

Nashville Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Nashville Fire Department and request their assistance.  The Facility maintains a trained (annually) incipient fire and hazardous substance emergency response team, as referenced above.  The Facility's emergency response plans are coordinated with the Nashville Fire Department and the Davidson County LEPC.  The Nashville Fire Department, which maintains a full hazardous response team, is aware of the Facility's butane blending system, access via Centennial Boulevard and 61st Avenue, and available fire suppression equipment including approximately twenty-four 20 lbs. ABC fire extinguishers, and water sources (nearest hydrant available at approximately 150 ft. distance from the vessel/off-loading point along 61st Avenue; additional units totaling three along the remainder of 61st Street and Centennial Boulevard).  Shell - Nashville Terminal maintains a vegetation control program to minimize plant growth within 10 ft. of the system.



In an effort to improve system safety, Shell intends to revalidate all system alarm set points and incorporate/update manufacturer (Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, L.P.) information relative to recommended inspections and associated frequencies.
